noun.description: In the Islamic regions of South-East Asia: custom, accepted practice.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in William Marsden (1754–1836), orientalist and numismatist. From Malay adat custom, convention, rule, law, customary law (Indonesian adat) from Persian ʿādat habit, custom from Arabic ʿādat-, ʿāda habit, custom, usage, practice.
